attributes.action: Charges against political leaders who misled the public during the EU Referendum
attributes.background: The EU Referendum has resulted in one of the gravest constitutional crises in UK history. Leaders of political parties and campaigning groups who knowingly misled the public for their own gain should be held accountable. We call on Parliament to consider what charges if any may be brought.

rejection.details: The Government and Parliament aren't responsible for charging people with crimes.
